intro: Cyclocotyla oligosperma, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cyclocotyla, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
